name: Pop Culture Knowledge Assessment
author: Claude
description: A comprehensive 50-question multiple choice assessment evaluating AI agent knowledge of contemporary pop culture including music, movies, TV shows, celebrities, internet culture, social media trends, and recent cultural phenomena.
systemPrompt: You are an AI assistant being evaluated on your knowledge of pop culture. Answer each multiple choice question by selecting the single best answer from the provided options. Choose the letter (A, B, C, or D) that corresponds to the most accurate answer based on your knowledge of contemporary culture, entertainment, social media trends, and popular phenomena. Only return the letter answer.

samples.input:
Which song by Billie Eilish won the Grammy Award for Song of the Year in 2020?
A. bad guy
B. Therefore I Am
C. Happier Than Ever
D. Lovely

In the Marvel Cinematic Universe, what is the name of Thor's hammer?
A. Stormbreaker
B. Mjolnir
C. Gungnir
D. Hofund

Which streaming platform is known for the series 'Stranger Things'?
A. Hulu
B. Amazon Prime Video
C. Netflix
D. Disney+

The phrase 'OK Boomer' became popular on which social media platform?
A. Instagram
B. TikTok
C. Twitter
D. Facebook

Which artist holds the record for the most Grammy wins of all time?
A. Taylor Swift
B. Adele
C. Beyoncé
D. Alicia Keys

In 'The Office' (US version), what is the name of Jim's wife?
A. Karen
B. Pam
C. Angela
D. Kelly

Which superhero movie became the highest-grossing film of 2019?
A. Captain Marvel
B. Spider-Man: Far From Home
C. Avengers: Endgame
D. Joker

The reality show 'Keeping Up with the Kardashians' aired its final episode in which year?
A. 2020
B. 2021
C. 2022
D. 2023

Which song by The Weeknd spent the most weeks at #1 on the Billboard Hot 100?
A. Can't Feel My Face
B. Blinding Lights
C. The Hills
D. Starboy

What does 'stan' mean in internet slang?
A. To criticize someone harshly
B. To be an obsessive fan of someone
C. To ignore someone completely
D. To collaborate with someone

Which actress plays Eleven in 'Stranger Things'?
A. Sadie Sink
B. Maya Hawke
C. Millie Bobby Brown
D. Natalia Dyer

The viral dance 'The Floss' originated from which video game?
A. Roblox
B. Fortnite
C. Minecraft
D. Among Us

Which member of One Direction was the first to release a solo album?
A. Harry Styles
B. Liam Payne
C. Zayn Malik
D. Niall Horan

'Baby Yoda' is the popular name for which character?
A. Yoda
B. Grogu
C. Yaddle
D. Vandar Tokare

Which app is known for short-form vertical videos?
A. Vine
B. Instagram
C. TikTok
D. Snapchat

In 'Game of Thrones,' what is the name of Jon Snow's direwolf?
A. Summer
B. Lady
C. Nymeria
D. Ghost

Which artist interrupted Taylor Swift's acceptance speech at the 2009 MTV VMAs?
A. Jay-Z
B. Kanye West
C. Drake
D. Eminem

The meme 'Distracted Boyfriend' features a man looking at another woman while his girlfriend looks disapproving. What stock photo company created this image?
A. Getty Images
B. Shutterstock
C. Adobe Stock
D. Unsplash

Which social media platform uses the tagline 'Be Real'?
A. BeReal
B. Instagram
C. Snapchat
D. TikTok

In the Disney movie 'Frozen,' what is the name of the snowman?
A. Sven
B. Kristoff
C. Olaf
D. Hans

Which streaming service produced 'The Queen's Gambit'?
A. Netflix
B. HBO Max
C. Apple TV+
D. Amazon Prime Video

The term 'Karen' in internet culture typically refers to:
A. A helpful customer service representative
B. A demanding, entitled person who asks to speak to the manager
C. A social media influencer
D. A tech-savvy individual

Which boy band sang 'What Makes You Beautiful'?
A. Backstreet Boys
B. *NSYNC
C. One Direction
D. BTS

In 'The Mandalorian,' what is the main character's real name?
A. Jango Fett
B. Boba Fett
C. Din Djarin
D. Paz Vizsla

Which platform is primarily known for professional networking?
A. Facebook
B. LinkedIn
C. Twitter
D. Instagram

The movie 'Black Panther' is set in which fictional African nation?
A. Genosha
B. Wakanda
C. Latveria
D. Sokovia

Which reality competition show features the catchphrase 'Come on down!'?
A. Wheel of Fortune
B. Jeopardy!
C. The Price is Right
D. Family Feud

The acronym 'FOMO' stands for:
A. Fear of Missing Out
B. Friends Over Money Only
C. Fun Over Money Obviously

Which artist released the album 'folklore' in 2020?
A. Ariana Grande
B. Taylor Swift
C. Billie Eilish
D. Dua Lipa

In internet culture, what does 'sliding into DMs' mean?
A. Posting a story on social media
B. Sending a private message to someone

D. Sharing someone's content

Which TV show features the character Walter White?
A. Better Call Saul
B. Breaking Bad
C. Ozark
D. Narcos

The song 'Old Town Road' by Lil Nas X samples which Nine Inch Nails track?

B. Closer

D. Head Like a Hole

A. Instagram
B. Twitter
C. Snapchat
D. Facebook

B. Marcel
C. Curious
D. Abu

The phrase 'It's giving...' in Gen Z slang means:
A. It's expensive
B. It's confusing
C. It has the vibe/energy of
D. It's disappointing

Which movie won the Academy Award for Best Picture in 2020?
A. 1917
B. Joker

The dating app known for swiping right or left is:
A. Bumble
B. Hinge
C. Tinder
D. Match

B. BTS
C. TWICE
D. Red Velvet

The term 'ghosting' in modern dating refers to:
A. Dating someone secretly
B. Suddenly cutting off all communication
C. Going on a first date
D. Meeting someone online

Which actress plays Katniss Everdeen in 'The Hunger Games'?
A. Emma Stone
B. Jennifer Lawrence
C. Shailene Woodley
D. Emma Watson

A. TikTok
B. Instagram
C. YouTube

C. J. Cole
D. Big Sean

B. Ask a question

D. Show confusion

Which TV series is set in the fictional town of Hawkins, Indiana?
A. Dark
B. Stranger Things
C. The X-Files

The social media challenge that involved dumping ice water on oneself was called:
A. The Mannequin Challenge
B. The Ice Bucket Challenge
C. The Harlem Shake
D. The Cinnamon Challenge

Which streaming platform produces 'The Boys'?
A. Netflix
B. Hulu
C. Amazon Prime Video
D. HBO Max

The term 'stan' comes from which Eminem song?
A. Lose Yourself
B. The Real Slim Shady
C. Stan
D. Without Me

Which social media platform is owned by Meta (formerly Facebook)?
A. TikTok
B. Twitter
C. Instagram
D. Snapchat

The movie 'Top Gun: Maverick' is a sequel to the original 'Top Gun' from which decade?
A. 1970s
B. 1980s
C. 1990s
D. 2000s

In Gen Z slang, 'no cap' means:

B. No lie/telling the truth
C. No money
D. No problem
